translation: Vol. 8

source_sentence: 大唐三藏法師義淨奉　制譯
translation: translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Yijingfeng of the Great Tang

source_sentence: 「時諸苾芻咸皆有疑，而白佛言：『世尊！
translation: The monks then all had doubts and said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是具一切智能斷諸疑。
translation: He's endowed with all kinds of wisdom and cuts off doubt.

source_sentence: 我等不審，優樓頻螺作何業故？
translation: We do not know what action Uruvilvāparvata has done.

source_sentence: 以五百神變而能調伏。
translation: He's able to subdue them with five hundred miraculous transformations.

source_sentence: 那提迦攝、伽耶迦攝任運調伏？』
translation: Nadīka gathers and Gayāga gathers, and he freely subdues them?'

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：『彼迦攝波所集資糧業，汝等善聽，我當為說。』
translation: The Buddha told the monks, 'That's the accumulated karma gathered by Kāśyapa, so listen well; I will explain it for you.'

source_sentence: 乃至頌曰如前。
translation: The verse goes so far as to say, As before.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：『往古昔時，此賢劫中人壽二萬歲，有佛世尊號曰迦攝如來，十號具足，出現於世，在波羅痆斯城仙人墮處施鹿園中。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, 'In the distant past, when the human life span was 20,000 years in this good eon, there was a buddha Bhagavān named Kāśyapa Tathāgata with the full set of ten names who appeared in the world and fell into the Deer Park to the sage in the city of Vārāṇasī.

source_sentence: 時彼世尊佛事已畢而入涅槃，時有國王名吉利枳，積諸香木而用焚燒，復以香乳灑火令滅，以四寶瓶盛其舍利，於形勝地起窣堵波，縱廣一踰繕那、高半踰繕那。
translation: When that Bhagavān had completed his service to the Buddha and entered nirvāṇa, a king named Jiliṭṭha built a stupa one yojana in width and half a yojana in height on the ground of Vaiśeṣika’s superior shape.

source_sentence: 時波羅痆斯城有一長者，其家巨富，財寶豐饒多有受用，如薜室羅末拏天。
translation: At the time, there was an elderly man in the city of Vārāṇasī whose family was so wealthy and rich in possessions that they had many uses, just like the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

source_sentence: 而彼長者，於同類家娶女為妻，共相娛樂後生三子。
translation: The wealthy man then married a woman of the same family as his wife and had three sons after they were entertained together.

source_sentence: 長者後時忽染疾病，種種方藥不能得差，奄就命終。
translation: At some point later, the elder suddenly became ill and couldn't be cured by various prescriptions or medicines, and died.

source_sentence: 時彼子等，種種繒綵裝飾其輿，送彼寒林以火焚燒，號叫悲泣喪事已畢。
translation: Those children then decorated their carriages with various kinds of silk, sent them to the cold forest and burned it in fire, wailing and weeping in pity after the funeral service was over.

source_sentence: 時長兄言：「所有財物吾今欲分。」
translation: The elder brother then said, Now, I want to share all my possessions.

source_sentence: 時彼二弟而不隨從。
translation: Those two disciples then didn't follow them.

source_sentence: 其兄數數言欲分之，二弟報曰：「若如此者，先修福業然後聽分。」
translation: His brother repeatedly wanted to divide it, but the two brothers replied, If that's the case, first cultivate meritorious actions and then listen to the division.

source_sentence: 兄言：「作何等業？」
translation: The brother said, What's the action?

source_sentence: 弟曰：「於迦攝佛窣堵波處而為供養。」
translation: The younger brother said, I'll make offerings at the place where Kāśyapa Buddha's stūpa is located.

source_sentence: 時兄不信，多時致難，後始隨許。
translation: At the time, his brother didn't believe it, and often caused difficulties, so he began to follow it afterward.

source_sentence: 其二弟以種種珍異，於迦攝佛窣堵波所作供養已，便發願言：「由此善根，願我同於迦攝波佛、應、正等覺所，授最上記：『摩納婆！
translation: Having offered various treasures and offerings to the Kāśyapa Buddha's stupa, the two disciples then made a vow, saying, Because of these good roots, may I share them with Kāśyapa Buddha, Worthy of Offerings, and Perfectly Enlightened One in bestowing the most superior one, 'Mānava!

source_sentence: 汝於來世人壽百歲時，當得作佛號釋迦牟尼如來、應、正等覺，彼佛法中而得出家，獲殊勝果。』」
translation: In the future life of a hundred years, you'll become a buddha named Śākyamuni Tathāgata, Arhat, and Completely Awakened One who leaves home in the midst of that Buddha's teaching and attains extraordinary rewards.'

source_sentence: 兄聞弟等發是願已，頂禮雙足即發善願。
translation: After the brothers and others heard this vow, they bowed their heads and feet and made a good vow.

source_sentence: 而我惡性不信正法，由此隨喜善根，亦於彼釋迦牟尼佛，與我五百神變，而見調伏令我出家，既出家已便獲勝果。
translation: Because my bad nature doesn't believe in the right teaching, and because of this good root of joy that follows, I also see Śākyamuni Buddha give me five hundred miraculous transformations to tame and cause me to leave home, and after leaving home, I'll attain superior results.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻勿作異念，彼長兄急性不信正法者，是優樓頻螺迦攝。
translation: You monks, don't think differently. That elder brother who doesn't believe in the right teaching with a sense of urgency is included in Uruvilvā-kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 其二弟者，即那提迦攝、伽耶迦攝等。
translation: The two disciples are namely, the Nādika and the Gayāga.

source_sentence: 是由願力故，以五百神變而能調伏之，其那提迦攝、伽耶迦攝而易調伏。
translation: Because of the power of their vow, they were able to subdue them with five hundred miraculous transformations, and they were easy to subdue because they were collected by Nādika and collected by Gayāga.

source_sentence: 頻毘娑羅王為太子時，王舍城中有一長者，彼有園苑花菓茂盛，心常愛戀。
translation: When King Bimbisāra was a prince, there was an elderly man in the city of Rājagṛha who had a garden with plenty of flowers and fruit that he loved.

source_sentence: 時頻毘娑羅太子出外，乃見彼園苑，見已即便生愛樂想，告長者曰：「卿可與我此園苑。」
translation: When Prince Bimbisāra went out to the outside, he saw that park and garden, and after seeing it, he gave rise to a feeling of delight.

source_sentence: 長者心生悋惜，竟不與之。
translation: The wealthy man cherished a feeling of stinginess in his heart and did not give it to him.

source_sentence: 如此三返皆不隨從，太子復告曰：「與汝財物園可屬我。」
translation: These three times, he didn't follow them, and the prince again told him, Give me your property and garden to belong to me.

source_sentence: 彼答太子曰：「乍可出國終不能與。」
translation: They replied to the prince, At first, you can leave the country and never give it away.

source_sentence: 太子復告長者：「當念我言：『若得王位必定取之。』」
translation: The prince then again told the elder, You should think of me and say, 'If you attain the king's throne, you must surely take it.'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：「汝得王位我必當出。」
translation: The elder replied, If you attain the king's throne, I will surely leave.

source_sentence: 太子曰：「汝可記憶，我是頻毘娑羅太子。」
translation: The prince said, Remember, I'm Prince Bimbisara.

source_sentence: 作是語已便即迴車。
translation: After he said this, he then turned his chariot around.

source_sentence: 乃至後時，大蓮華王而年衰老，奄就命終，便以太子紹王。
translation: At some point later, when the great lotus king grew old and died, he was succeeded to the throne as prince.

source_sentence: 既得王位，強力奪彼園苑。
translation: Having attained the throne of kingship, he forcibly plundered that park.

source_sentence: 彼長者便生熱惱，而得心病，怨恨而死。
translation: The elder then became feverish and suffered from a mental illness, and died in anger.

source_sentence: 於此園中住，作一毒蛇，其蛇常於王所伺求方便。
translation: He lived in this park and made a viper, which always sought the king’s advice.

source_sentence: 後於芳春之月，王與宮人及諸婇女，往詣園中除去左右，與諸眷屬歡喜受樂，便即睡眠。
translation: Later, in the month of fragrant spring, the king, his palace officials, and the court ladies went to the garden to remove their left and right. The king and his retainers rejoiced and enjoyed happiness. Then they fell asleep.

source_sentence: 諸女愛花皆捨王去，唯有一女執刀而衛護王。
translation: The women who loved the flowers all abandoned the king, leaving only one woman to guard him with a sword.

source_sentence: 是時彼蛇見諸女眾皆悉遊散，從穴疾出而欲螫王。
translation: Seeing the women, the snake then scattered them all and emerged from its hole with a painful illness in order to sting the king.

source_sentence: 王福力故，羯蘭鐸迦鳥圍遶其蛇而眾發聲，彼執刀女聞眾鳥聲，復見毒蛇而來向王，即以利刀斷彼蛇命。
translation: Because of the king's power of fortune, the kalaṇḍika bird surrounded the snake and many people raised their voices, and the woman holding the sword heard the sounds of the birds. Again, she saw a poisonous snake coming toward the king and cut off its life with a sharp sword.

source_sentence: 女為怖故便發大呼，時王從睡驚寤而起，便問女言：「此為何事？」
translation: Because of fear, the woman called out in a loud voice, and then the king rose from sleep in terror and asked the woman, What's the matter here?

source_sentence: 女報王曰：「毒蛇欲來螫王，羯蘭鐸迦鳥群聲遶蛇，我已斷訖。」
translation: The woman reported to the king, A poisonous snake wants to come and stung the king, and a kalaṇḍaka bird surrounds the snake with its sounds; I've finished cutting it off.

source_sentence: 王聞此事，便勅太子群臣，集王舍城所有人民，在此園苑遠近盈滿聞亂發聲。
translation: When the king heard this, he ordered his prince's ministers to gather all the people in Rājagṛha and assemble them here at the park, which was filled with sounds of disturbance from near and far.

source_sentence: 其王善治國境內外，諸人聞已皆大悲泣，王告諸人：「若剎帝利灌頂王，有人救命合酬何願？」
translation: The king governed his country well, both inside and outside its borders, and when the people heard this, they all cried out in great grief.

source_sentence: 群臣白王：「合酬彼人半國之賞。」
translation: The ministers said to the king, It's enough to reward that person with half a national reward.

source_sentence: 王言：「羯蘭鐸迦鳥而救我命。
translation: The king said, Kālāndaka bird saves my life.

source_sentence: 若如是者，宜與半國之賞。」
translation: If you do so, it's advisable to give the reward of half a kingdom.

source_sentence: 大臣復白王曰：「羯蘭鐸迦鳥而非人類，縱得王賞將何所用？
translation: The minister again said to the king, Kālāndaka's bird isn't a human being; what will be its use even if it gets the king's reward?

source_sentence: 其此園苑，施與羯蘭鐸迦鳥，復於終身供給飲食。」
translation: In this park, he gave it to the Kalandaka bird and offered food and drink for his whole life.

source_sentence: 王曰：「如卿所言。」
translation: The king said, As you say.

source_sentence: 時諸群臣令其園苑周遍蒔竹，以此緣故，號為羯蘭鐸迦竹園。』
translation: The ministers then ordered his garden to be surrounded by bamboo trees, and for this reason it was called the Kalandaka Bamboo Park.'

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊遊行摩羯陀人間王舍城外，在一樹下便住其處。
translation: “At the time, the Bhagavān traveled outside the city of the human king’s dwelling place in Magadha and stayed there under a tree.

source_sentence: 時影勝王聞佛到王舍城外在一樹下，與諸眷屬出王舍城，來詣佛所頂禮佛足退坐一面。
translation: When the king of Vaiśeṣika heard that the Buddha had arrived outside Rājagaha, he stayed under a tree and left Rājagaha with his retinues. They came to the Buddha in Rājagaha, bowed at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為說妙法，示教利喜已默然而住。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān explained the wonderful teaching for them, showed them how to benefit and rejoice, and remained silent.

source_sentence: 時影勝王從座而起，偏袒右肩、右膝著地、合掌恭敬而白佛言：『唯願世尊及諸苾芻，於明晨朝受我微供。』
translation: The king of Vaiśeṣika then rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee to the ground, joined his palms in respect, and said to the Buddha, 'May the Bhagavān and the monks, please accept my humble offerings tomorrow morning.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊默然受請。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān accepted the invitation by remaining silent.

source_sentence: 時影勝王知佛受請頂禮佛足還至本宮，勅諸眷屬，令辦種種微妙飲食敷設床座，於彼座前，寶瓶盛水安置會中。
translation: Knowing that the Buddha had accepted the invitation, King Śākyamuni bowed his head at his feet and returned to his palace, ordered his retinues to prepare a variety of delicious foods, spread out a bed and seat, and placed a precious pot filled with water in front of that seat in the assembly.

source_sentence: 既敷設已便勅使者，往世尊所白言：『時到。』
translation: After laying out the bed, he then instructed his messengers to go to the Bhagavān and tell him, 'The time has come.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，於晨朝時著衣持鉢，與苾芻眾前後圍遶，入王舍城至王宮中，洗手足已敷座而坐。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, wearing his robes and bowl in the morning, surrounded by the monks before and behind him, entered Rājagṛha and went to the palace, washed his hands and feet, spread out his seat, and sat down.

source_sentence: 時王見佛與諸苾芻寂然安坐，時影勝王自手斟酌種種美食，而為供養相續不絕，皆令飽足。
translation: When the king saw that the Buddha and the monks were sitting quietly in peace, King Śākyamuni then prepared various delicious foods with his own hands to offer them as offerings without cease, making them all satisfied.

source_sentence: 飯食已訖，王自行水。
translation: When the meal was over, the king brought water for his own use.

source_sentence: 佛及苾芻澡漱已畢，王取寶瓶灌世尊掌，而白佛言：『我毘婆迦蘭陀園奉施世尊，唯願納受。』
translation: After the Buddha and the monks had finished washing and rinsing, the king took the jeweled vase and poured it into the Bhagavān's palm and said to the Buddha, 'My Vaiśravaṇa Park is offered to the Bhagavān, so please accept it.'

source_sentence: 「『所為布施者，　　必獲其義利；
translation: 'Those who make donations will surely attain their meaning and benefit.

source_sentence: 為利樂布施，　　後必得安樂。』
translation: Giving for profit and pleasure will surely bring peace and happiness later.'

source_sentence: 時佛世尊即說呪願頌曰：「爾時世尊說此頌已，與諸苾芻即便往詣羯蘭鐸迦園，止住其中。
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke a dhāraṇī of the vow, saying, After the Bhagavān spoke this verse, he and the monks went to the Kalandaka Park and stayed there.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，結集尊者於經中說，佛在此羯蘭鐸迦園，乃至舍利弗目揵連出家，得阿羅漢道。
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, the Venerable Kauśinagara said in the sūtras that the Buddha stayed here at Kalandaka's Park, up to Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana left home and attained the arhat path.

source_sentence: 「爾時王舍城中有一長者，請佛世尊及苾芻眾於家供養。
translation: At the time, there was an elder in Rājagṛha who invited the Bhagavān and the monks to make offerings at home.

source_sentence: 於此之時，給孤獨長者別有緣事至王舍城此長者家，便即止宿。
translation: At the time, the orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika had another reason to stay overnight at the house of this elder in Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 其長者於夜初分，即起呼諸家眷屬：『賢首！
translation: At the beginning of the night, that elder rose and called out to his family members, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 聖者可起取薪然火、濾水造諸飲食、掃灑塗地、敷妙勝座。』
translation: The noble one can get up, take firewood, filter water, prepare food and drink, sweep the ground, and spread out a marvelous seat.'

source_sentence: 時給孤長者聞此語已，作如是念：『此長者家，為復嫁女？
translation: After hearing these words, the orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika thought, 'Is this elder's house for another wife?'

source_sentence: 為當娶妻？
translation: Why should he take his wife?

source_sentence: 為復屈勝上客？
translation: Why is it further inferior to the superior guest?

source_sentence: 為復請人？
translation: Why do you again invite someone?

source_sentence: 為復請國王家內設食？』
translation: Why would you again invite the king to set up food inside his house?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，復問長者向所念事，長者答曰：『亦不嫁女、娶妻、屈客并及王等。
translation: After he had this thought, he again asked the elder about what he was thinking. The elder answered, 'He won't marry a woman, take a wife, or bow to anyone or the king.

source_sentence: 如所敷設，明日請佛世尊及僧伽苾芻眾，如法設食。』
translation: As prepared, he invites the Bhagavān Buddha and the saṃgha monks to set up food in accordance with the rules on the following day.'

source_sentence: 時給孤獨長者初聞佛名，遍身毛竪心生歡喜，問主長者曰：『是何名佛？』
translation: When the orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika first heard the Buddha's name, his hair stood on end all over his body and his heart rejoiced, and he asked the householder, 'What's the name of the Buddha?'

source_sentence: 主即答言：『有喬答摩沙門釋迦之子，從釋迦種中以正信故，剃除鬚髮、被著法衣，從家趣於非家，證得無上正等菩提，號之為佛。』
translation: The lord then answered, 'There's the son of the Śākyamuni Gautama who shaved off his hair and beard, put on his religious robes, went from home to a non-house, realized unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and called him Buddha.'

source_sentence: 彼復問曰：『何名僧伽？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'What's the name of the saṃgha?'

source_sentence: 主復答言：『有善男子從剎利種，以正信故，歸佛出家，剃除鬚髮被著法衣，從家趣於非家，名為僧伽。
translation: Again, the lord answered, 'There are good men of the kṣatriya class who, because of right faith, return to the Buddha and leave home, shave their hair and beard, put on the Dharma robes, and go from home to what's not home, which is called a saṃgha.

source_sentence: 亦有善男子，從婆羅門種族、從薜舍種族、從戍達羅種族，以信心故，剃除鬚髮被著袈裟，從家趣於非家，出家修道，名為僧伽。
translation: Good sons, there are also people of the brāhmaṇa, kṣatriya, and śūdra classes who, out of faith, shave their hair, beard, and hair, don the yellow monastic robes, leave home and go forth from one house to another, leaving home to practice Buddhism. This is called a sangha.

source_sentence: 我請彼佛及僧伽眾，明日於此家中以食供養。』
translation: I'll invite those buddhas and the saṃgha to make offerings of food at my house tomorrow.'

source_sentence: 復問長者：『彼佛今在何處？』
translation: Again, he asked the elder, 'Where is that Buddha now?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『今在寒林棄尸之所毘訶羅住。』
translation: He answered, 'Now, I'm staying at Vaiśravaṇa in the cold forest where I abandoned my corpse.'

source_sentence: 給孤獨長者又復問曰：『我可得見彼佛不？』
translation: Again, the elder Anāthapiṇḍika asked, 'Can I see that Buddha?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『汝可得見，然於此待。
translation: The elder replied, 'You may see it, but wait here.'

source_sentence: 若明日世尊至，汝必得見。』
translation: If the Bhagavān arrives tomorrow, you'll surely see him.'

source_sentence: 是時給孤長者繫念於佛，便即昏沈，忽然驚寤而天未曙心作明想，行詣善自在城門。
translation: The orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika then concentrated his thoughts on the Buddha, went into darkness, suddenly became frightened, and before dawn, he had a bright thought in his mind and traveled to the gate of the city of Suneśvara.

source_sentence: 其國常法，夜分初更不閉，防外使來令無障礙，於後夜分城門亦開，用防內使無有障礙。
translation: The kingdom's constant rule was that the city gates would not be closed at the first watch of the night, to prevent outside messengers from coming and staying unobstructed. At the second watch of the night, the city gates would also be opened, so that there wouldn't be any obstruction if he guarded the inside messengers.

source_sentence: 給孤長者，見門開明隨明而出，既出城門光明即沒。
translation: An orphaned elderly man saw the door open and went out in accordance with the light, and when he left the city gate, the light disappeared.

source_sentence: 是時天暗，心生怖懼身毛皆竪。
translation: At the time, the sky was dark, and his mind became frightened, and all his hair stood on end.

source_sentence: 『我今於此，恐人及非人而見損害。』
translation: 'Now, here, I'm afraid people and non-people will see harm.'

source_sentence: 作此念已即欲却迴。
translation: After he had this thought, he wanted to turn away.

source_sentence: 時此城門所居天神即放光明，從城門外乃至寒林，於其中間而皆大明。
translation: The celestial spirits at the city gate then radiated a ray of light, and from outside the city gates up to the cold forest in between them all became very bright.

source_sentence: 其神復報長者曰：『汝可前行，有大饒益勿生迴想。
translation: The gods again reported to the elder, 'You may go ahead and have great benefits, so don't give rise to thoughts of turning back.

source_sentence: 何以故？』
translation: Why is it so?'

source_sentence: 「『駿馬滿百匹，　　紫磨金百斤；
translation: 'Sutra horses are full of a hundred horses, and the purple polished gold weighs a hundred pounds.

source_sentence: 馭牝兩車輪，　　其數皆有百。
translation: The charioteer’s and the queen’s wheels were each one hundred in number.

source_sentence: 載以種種物，　　而用行檀施；
translation: Carry various things And practice giving with charity.

source_sentence: 不如發一步，　　向佛之功德，
translation: It's better to give rise to one step, which is directed toward the Buddha's virtue.

source_sentence: 如是等校量，　　十六分中一。
translation: These are measured in sixteen parts:

source_sentence: 假使象百頭，　　皆以金交絡，
translation: Suppose an elephant has a hundred heads, All interlocked with gold.

source_sentence: 復載妙寶帳，　　而用行檀施；
translation: He also carried a wonderful jeweled curtain And offered it to them with sandalwood.

source_sentence: 不如發一步，　　向佛之功德，
translation: It's better to give rise to one step, which is directed toward the Buddha's virtue.

source_sentence: 十六分中一。　　復有百美女，
translation: One of the sixteen parts had a hundred beautiful women.

source_sentence: 婇媛中最勝，　　頸絡妙珠瓔，
translation: The most distinguished among the nymphs, With a necklace of beautiful pearls around their necks.

source_sentence: 臂搖眾寶釧，　　如是行檀施；
translation: Shaking the jeweled necklace with one’s arm, They practice giving in this way.

source_sentence: 不如發一步，　　向佛之功德，
translation: It's better to give rise to one step, which is directed toward the Buddha's virtue.

source_sentence: 十六分中一。』
translation: One of the sixteen parts is one.'

source_sentence: 而說頌曰：「天復告曰：『汝可前行，有大饒益，勿生迴想。』
translation: He spoke a verse, saying, Again, the gods told him, 'You may go ahead and have great benefit, so don't give rise to thoughts of turning back.'

source_sentence: 時給孤長者而白天曰：『賢首！
translation: An orphaned elder then gave it to the gods and said, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 汝是何人？』
translation: Who are you?'

source_sentence: 彼天答曰：『我昔是汝善友，名摩頭肩，我於舍利弗、大目揵連，甚大信心尊重禮拜，命終之後生四天王宮，為護眾生住此善自在城門。
translation: The gods replied, 'In the past, I was your good friend named Mahāprajāpaṇḍapālī, and I worshiped Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana with great faith and reverence. When my life ended, I was born in the palace of the four heavenly kings and stayed here at the city gate of Sudarśana to protect sentient beings.

source_sentence: 是汝昔友，今故相告。
translation: This was your friend of the past, and now I'll tell you about it.

source_sentence: 汝可前行有大利益，勿生退想。』
translation: You may have done a great service in the past, so don't give rise to thoughts of retrogression.'

source_sentence: 爾時給孤長者心作是念：『佛者，超出異生，不同餘聖，其所說法深可尊重，是故諸天見佛生大歡喜。』
translation: It was then that the orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika thought, 'The Buddha transcends ordinary people and is different from other sages; his teaching is profound and venerable, so the gods who see the Buddha become very joyous.'

source_sentence: 念已乘天光明即詣寒林。
translation: After he thought this, he rode the celestial light and went to the cold forest.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知給孤長者來故，即出寺門而以經行。
translation: Knowing that the orphaned elder had come, the Bhagavān then left the temple gates and walked up and down with his sūtras.

source_sentence: 給孤長者前至佛所，以居士法問訊世尊：『寢膳安不？』
translation: An orphaned elder went to the Buddha in front of him, greeted the Bhagavān with the householder's instructions, 'Is it safe for you to sleep and eat?'

source_sentence: 「『離一切煩惱，　　心不染諸欲；
translation: Being free of all afflictions, his mind isn’t stained by desires.

source_sentence: 得無漏解脫，　　常得安樂眠。
translation: Attaining uncontaminated liberation, they always attain peaceful sleep.

source_sentence: 斷一切結縛，　　心息熱煩惱；
translation: He has cut off all bonds, Extinguishing feverishable afflictions in his mind.

source_sentence: 寂靜得心者，　　乃可安樂眠。』
translation: Those who attain mind in quiescence can then sleep peacefully.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊以頌答曰：「爾時世尊說是頌已，與給孤長者俱還精舍敷座而坐，給孤長者頂禮佛足退坐一面。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān answered in verse, After he spoke this verse, the Bhagavān returned to the monastery with the orphaned elderly man and spread his seat on it, and the orphaned elderly man bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 時世尊為給孤長者，演說妙法示教利喜。
translation: The Bhagavān then taught the wonderful Dharma for the elder Anāthapiṇḍika, showing benefit and joy.

source_sentence: 如佛常法：所謂先說布施功德、持戒功德、受天果報功德，不樂諸欲過失受煩惱事，讚歎出家清淨觀察殊勝功德，宗法廣為演說。
translation: It's like the Buddha's eternal teaching: First, he explains the merit of generosity, the merit of observance of precepts, the merit of receiving the rewards of heavenly rewards, the merit of not delighting in the faults of desire and suffering afflictions, the superior merit of praising renunciant purity and contemplation, and the extensive explanation of the doctrinal teachings.

source_sentence: 世尊知給孤長者心生踊躍歡喜，心無障礙堪受勝法善能了知。
translation: The Bhagavān knew that the orphaned elder's mind became excited and joyous, and his mind had no obstruction in accepting the superior teaching well enough to understand it.

source_sentence: 是時世尊為說勝法，所謂苦集滅道，此四諦法廣大演說。
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the superior teaching for them, which is called the path to suffering, arising, cessation, and the path, and these four truths are extensively explained as dharmas.

source_sentence: 猶如離垢淨衣將染受鮮好色，給孤長者亦復如是，不離本座證四聖諦，所謂苦集滅道。
translation: It's like giving an orphaned elder who doesn't part from his seat to realize the four noble truths, which are called the path of suffering, accumulation, cessation, and cessation.

source_sentence: 給孤獨長者，以見法已得法、了知法深入法，斷諸疑惑不受他教，自能了知不被他引，於師教中心無怖畏。
translation: An orphaned orphaned elder who sees the teaching and has attained the teaching, knows the teaching and penetrates deeply into the teaching, stops doubt and doesn't accept the teaching from others, understands it for himself without being led by others, and has no fear in the center of his teacher's teaching.

source_sentence: 時給孤獨長者，從座而起偏露一肩，即於佛前合掌恭敬，而白佛言：『我已入法，一心歸佛、歸法及苾芻僧伽。
translation: An orphaned elderly monk then stood up from his seat, bared one shoulder, joined his palms in respect before the Buddha, and said to him, 'I've entered the Dharma, singlemindedly taking refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and bhikṣus and saṃgha.

source_sentence: 唯願授我鄔波索迦戒，從今盡命、永斷殺生、心淨歸依。』
translation: Please grant me the Upāsaka precepts, so that from now on I'll end my life, permanently stop killing people, and take refuge in purity of mind.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告給孤獨長者曰：『汝名字何？』
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the elder Anāthapiṇḍika, 'What's your name?'

source_sentence: 長者白曰：『我名蘇達多，然我資給孤獨食，是故諸人號給孤獨。』
translation: The elder said, 'My name is Sudarśana, but I provide food for orphans and solitary people; therefore, people are called orphans and solitary.'

source_sentence: 佛告長者曰：『汝何處人？』
translation: The Buddha told the elder, 'Where are you people?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『在此北方嬌薩羅國室羅筏城外有邑，我住彼中。
translation: The elder replied, 'There's a town outside the city of Rāvaṇasī in the country of Kauśala to the north here, and I live there.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊而受我請詣室羅筏城，受我供養乃至盡形，及苾芻僧伽四事供養。』
translation: Please, Bhagavān, accept my invitation to go to the city of Śrāvastī and receive my offerings up to the end of my life as well as the four kinds of offerings for the monks and nuns.'

source_sentence: 佛告長者曰：『室羅筏城中有寺以不？』
translation: The Buddha told the elder, 'Is there a temple in Śrāvastī?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『彼城無寺。』
translation: The elder replied, 'There's no temple in that city.'

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：『彼若有寺，僧伽應來往。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, 'If there's a temple, the saṃgha should come and go.

source_sentence: 彼既無寺，若為安置？』
translation: Since they don't have a temple, why would they place it there?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『唯願世尊而受我請向室羅筏城，我當造寺令苾芻眾往來安置止息思惟。』
translation: The elder answered, 'Please, Bhagavān, accept my invitation to go to the city of Śrāvastī, and I will build a temple so that the monks will come and go, place themselves there, and meditate calmly.'

source_sentence: 世尊默然受請。
translation: The Bhagavān accepted the invitation by remaining silent.

source_sentence: 是時長者知佛許已，即從座起頂禮佛足却還本處。
translation: Knowing that the Buddha had given his permission, the elder then rose from his seat, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and returned to his original place.

source_sentence: 「彼時長者，王舍城中事既了已，還至佛所頂禮佛足却坐一面，而白佛言：『唯願世尊遣一苾芻與我為伴，往室羅筏造立住處，安置世尊及苾芻僧眾。』
translation: After he had finished his duties in Rājagṛha, the elder then returned to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to one side, and said to him, 'May the Bhagavān send a monk to stay with me as my companion, go to Śrāvastī, build a dwelling place, and place the Bhagavān and the monks and bhikṣus there.'

source_sentence: 佛作是念：『苾芻眾中誰能調伏室羅筏城人及長者眷屬？』
translation: The Buddha thought, 'Who among the monks can subdue the people of Śrāvastī and their elders' retinues?'

source_sentence: 世尊知舍利弗堪彼調伏，世尊念已告具壽舍利弗言：『汝應觀察給孤獨長者眷屬及室羅筏城人，應往教化造立毘訶羅。』
translation: Knowing that Śāriputra was capable of being subdued by them, the Bhagavān had this thought and addressed Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra, saying, 'Should you observe that you should go to Anāthapiṇḍika's retinue and the people of Śrāvastī to teach and create Vaiśravaṇa?'

source_sentence: 舍利弗默然受佛勅已，頂禮佛足與長者同行。
translation: Śāriputra accepted the Buddha's command by remaining silent, bowed his head at his feet, and accompanied the elder.

source_sentence: 「爾時具壽舍利子，於夜分盡至明清旦，執持衣鉢入王舍大城次第乞食，却還本處飯食訖，攝衣鉢所有臥具，襞揲一處付餘苾芻，往室羅筏城。
translation: At the time, Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra, at the end of the night until dawn, he took his robes and bowl into the great city of Rājagṛha to solicit alms in order, returned to his original place for a meal, gathered his robes, bowl, bedding, and so forth, gave one place to the other monks, and went to Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時給孤長者資辦道糧，漸至室羅筏城外，遊諸園苑，林泉形勝可愛樂處，堪作寺舍。
translation: The orphaned elder then prepared the provisions for the path, gradually went outside the city of Śrāvastī and traveled to various parks and pleasures, such as forests and fountains with beautiful shapes and pleasing places that could be made into temple buildings.

source_sentence: 『去室羅筏城不遠不近，寂靜無有雜聲，亦無大風復不大熱，亦無蚊虻蛇蠍等。
translation: 'It's not far from the city of Śrāvastī or near it, tranquil and without mixed sounds, there's no great wind or heat, and there are no gnats, gadflies, snakes, scorpions, or other creatures.

source_sentence: 有此勝地，為我世尊造立寺舍。』
translation: 'There's this excellent place where I, the Bhagavān, built a temple for me.'

source_sentence: 給孤長者遊行，至誓多太子園林中。
translation: An orphaned elderly man traveled to the garden and forest of Prince Sthavira.

source_sentence: 其園去城不遠不近，晝夜寂靜乃至無有諸毒虫等，堪作寺舍。
translation: The park is neither far from the city nor near it, and it's quiet day and night without poisonous insects or other things, so it can be used as a monastery.

source_sentence: 見此園已，入室羅筏城不歸本住，便往太子誓多宮所，而白太子言：『可與我彼園，當為世尊造立寺舍。』
translation: Seeing this park, he entered the city of Śrāvastī and didn't return to his original abode, went to the prince's vow many palaces, and said to the prince, 'Should you give me that park or build a monastery for the Bhagavān?'

source_sentence: 太子報曰：『彼非是園而是苑林。』
translation: The prince replied, 'That's not a garden but a forest.'

source_sentence: 長者復白曰：『無問園苑，處所與我。』
translation: The elder again said, 'No matter where the park is, give it to me.'

source_sentence: 如是三請，太子報曰：『我實不應而捨此園，縱得布金遍地，我終不與。』
translation: After these three requests, the prince replied, 'I really shouldn't abandon this park; even if I were to spread gold all over the ground, I wouldn't give it to you.'

source_sentence: 長者復白曰：『汝已定價，汝可取直，其園林屬我。』
translation: The elder again said, 'You've settled the price, so you can take it straight up; that park belongs to me.'

source_sentence: 太子報曰：『是誰定價？』
translation: The prince replied, 'Who set the price?'

source_sentence: 長者白曰：『汝自定價。』
translation: The elder said, 'You set your own price.'

source_sentence: 因即爭競不定，共詣斷事人所。
translation: As a result, they were unable to determine which of the two wrestlers to fight and went together to the place where the servants would be killed.

source_sentence: 爾時四天王聞斯事已便作是念：『今給孤長者為世尊造立寺舍，我當資助。』
translation: After hearing this, the four celestial kings of heaven then had this thought, 'Now, let's give an orphaned elder to build a monastery for the Bhagavān, and I will help him.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，遂即各化為斷事人，於法司坐。
translation: After he had this thought, they each transformed himself into a person who cut off service and sat down in the Dharma office.

source_sentence: 時誓多太子給孤長者，共到其處，給孤長者及太子各具因緣白。
translation: The prince Jīvaka then gave the orphaned elder to the orphaned elder, went there together, and gave the orphaned elder and the princes each a reason to tell him.

source_sentence: 斷事人議曰：『太子！
translation: He cut off the discussion of people and said, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 汝自定價，園屬長者，太子取金。』
translation: Your own price is fixed, and the park belongs to the wealthy man, while the prince takes the gold.'

source_sentence: 太子既見斷已，默然而去。
translation: Seeing this, the prince abstained and departed in silence.

source_sentence: 是時給孤長者，還家勅諸僮僕，以車象牛驢擔負筐籠，運載其金，至誓多林用布其地，有少未遍。
translation: At that time the orphaned householder Anāthapiṇḍika returned home and instructed his servants, carrying a cart, an elephant, an elephant-cattle donkey, and a basket of gold in their hands, to spread it on the ground in the cemetery, which was not covered even a little bit.

source_sentence: 于時長者心自思惟：『若取大藏金即太多，欲開小藏復恐不足。』
translation: The elder then thought to himself, 'If you take the large store of gold, it's too much; if you want to open the small store, it might not be enough.'

source_sentence: 又作是念：『諸藏之中何者不多不少，而得充足？』
translation: Again, he thought, 'Which of the stores is more or less abundant and attainable?'

source_sentence: 爾時太子見長者默住思惟，即便生念：『給孤長者心應生退，為一園林豈能捨此積集多金？』
translation: Seeing the elder's silent contemplation, the prince then thought, 'Should the orphaned elder give rise to retrogression in his mind? How could he abandon this accumulation of much gold for a single park and forest?'

source_sentence: 作是念已告長者曰：『汝心應退，當却收取金，其園還我。』
translation: After he had this thought, he told the elder, 'Withdraw your mind, you should withdraw and collect the gold; return it to me at that park.'

source_sentence: 長者告曰：『太子！
translation: The elder told him, 'Prince!

source_sentence: 我心不退，然心中所計，欲開何藏不多不少而得充足？』
translation: My mind doesn't regress, but what store do I want to open in my mind that's not numerous and abundant?'

source_sentence: 太子聞此語已便作是念：『世尊威德不可思議，其法亦不可思議，是故長者能捨積聚無量金寶。』
translation: After hearing these words, the prince thought, 'The Bhagavān's authority and virtue are inconceivable, and his teaching is also inconceivable; therefore, the wealthy man can abandon the accumulation of measureless gold treasures.'

source_sentence: 作此念已告長者曰：『其地金未遍處，應收却還，我為世尊而作寺門。』
translation: After he had this thought, he told the elder, 'That gold hasn't yet pervaded the place, so you should collect it and return it; I will make the temple gate for the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『隨意可為世尊而作寺門。』
translation: The elder replied, 'As you wish, you can make a temple gate for the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 「爾時給孤長者為世尊初欲造寺，諸外道眾極生怨恨心懷熱惱，共集一處往長者所。
translation: It was then that the orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika wanted to build a temple for the Bhagavān's first time, and the non-Buddhist monks became extremely hostile and angry, and they all gathered together in one place to go to an elder.

source_sentence: 到已便作是言：『長者！
translation: When he arrived, he said, 'Elder!

source_sentence: 汝不應為喬答摩沙門造立寺舍。
translation: You shouldn't build a temple for the monk Gautama.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 我等先已分界，彼王舍城可喬答摩居止，此室羅筏城而我等住，是故不應造寺。』
translation: We've previously divided our boundaries, and the city of Rājagṛha is where Kātyāma lives and we live in this city of Śrāvastī; therefore, we shouldn't build a temple.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『汝等祇可分自國境，不應共分我園，我所造功德皆由自心。』
translation: The elder replied, 'You can divide your own country and territory; you shouldn't divide our garden together; the merits I create all come from my own mind.'

source_sentence: 諸外道等見長者堅意不移，即詣王所具陳上事，給孤長者共對獲勝。
translation: Seeing that the elder's resolute mind didn't budge, the non-Buddhist monks went to the king and explained the above matters in detail, giving them to the orphaned elder to win.

source_sentence: 彼外道心生忿怒面現惡相，便作是語：『我終不從汝志，然喬答摩沙門上首弟子，與我等共相論議，若能勝我隨意造寺。』
translation: That non-Buddhist becomes angry in mind and shows bad appearance on his face, saying, 'I won't follow your wishes after all, but Gautama is the supreme disciple of the ascetic who argues with us together, so if he can overcome me and build a temple as he wishes.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『可爾！
translation: The elder replied, 'Yes!

source_sentence: 然我且問舍利子，若見許可，即來報汝。』
translation: Still, I'll ask Śāriputra, and if he grants me permission, I'll come to report back to you.'

source_sentence: 長者即往尊者舍利子所，頂禮雙足退坐一面，而即白言：『大德！
translation: The elder then went to Venerable Śāriputra, bowed his head and feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said, 'O great virtuous one!

source_sentence: 諸外道等皆作是語：「汝欲作寺，云我制汝。」
translation: The non-Buddhists all said, You want to build a temple, saying, I'll restrain you.

source_sentence: 又言：「喬答摩沙門上首弟子，今現在此與我論議，若能勝我聽汝造寺。」
translation: Again, he said, Gautama, the supreme disciple of the monk Mahāsthāmaṇa, is now here to discuss this with me, and if you can overcome him, I'll allow you to build a temple.

source_sentence: 未審尊者，如何當擬？』
translation: We haven't yet decided, venerable, how should we design it?'

source_sentence: 舍利子聞斯語已，便即觀察此輩外道及室羅人民，頗有善根不？
translation: Having heard these words, Śāriputra immediately observed whether the heretics and the śrāvakas among them had good roots.

source_sentence: 既觀察已知有善根。
translation: Having observed it, he knows that there are good roots.

source_sentence: 又復觀察：誰有善根堪調伏不？
translation: Again, he observes: Who has good roots that are capable of being disciplined?

source_sentence: 自心觀見我能調伏。
translation: He observes the self in his own mind and sees that I can tame it.

source_sentence: 又復觀察：幾時應來集會？
translation: Again, he observes: At how many moments should they come together?

source_sentence: 觀見根器，却後七日可能集會。
translation: He observed the faculties and vessel, but he was able to assemble seven days later.

source_sentence: 作觀察已告長者曰：『可隨汝意，却後七日我當論議。』
translation: After observing it, he told the elder, 'Follow your wishes, and I'll discuss it seven days from now.'

source_sentence: 給孤長者歡喜踴躍，頂禮舍利子足，往外道所而作是言：『聖者！
translation: The orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika rejoiced, bowed his head at Śāriputra's feet, went to a place outside the Way, and said, 'Noble one!

source_sentence: 舍利弗作如是語：「却後七日應當論議。」』
translation: Śāriputra said, Seven days from now, we should discuss it.'

source_sentence: 彼外道眾聞斯語已，共相謂曰：『有二種因緣。
translation: After hearing these words, the non-Buddhist crowd said to each other, 'There are two kinds of causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 何以為二？
translation: Why are they considered to be two?

source_sentence: 一者舍利子必應逃走，二者應覓伴侶，以此之緣延期七日。』
translation: One, Śāriputra should surely flee, and two, he should search for a companion, which is the reason why he postponed it for seven days.'

source_sentence: 外道復相謂曰：『我等亦可覓當宗知友。』
translation: Again, the non-Buddhists said to each other, 'We can also look for friends of our own school.'

source_sentence: 彼皆分頭散訪達本宗者，乃見一梵志名曰赤眼，善能幻化，既得見已便即告曰：『汝之與我同修道行，我等今呼喬答摩沙門上首弟子共為論議。
translation: They all scattered their heads to investigate the original doctrine and saw a brāhmaṇa named Red Eye, who was skilled in magical transformation. Seeing him, he said to them, “If you practice the same path of religion as me, we will now call the śramaṇa Gautama’s senior disciples to discuss this matter together.” The bhikṣuṇīs spoke thus:

source_sentence: 彼今已求伴侶，汝可共相資助。』
translation: Now that they've asked for a companion, you can help each other.'

source_sentence: 其梵志問曰：『幾時當論？』
translation: The priest asked, 'When will we discuss it?'

source_sentence: 報曰：『却後七日。』
translation: He replied, 'Seven days from now.'

source_sentence: 梵志答言：『可爾！
translation: The priest replied, 'Yes!

source_sentence: 若會集時汝當報我。』
translation: If you assemble at the time, you will repay me.'

source_sentence: 諸外道等恐怖煩惱每日各更求覓伴侶。
translation: Each day, non-Buddhists and other fearful afflictions each search for a companion.

source_sentence: 期程將滿至第七日，給孤長者於廣大勝地，為具壽舍利弗敷設師子勝妙高座，亦為外道而敷一座。
translation: On the seventh day, when the journey was about to end, he gave the orphaned elder a lion's seat and spread it out for Kauśāriputra in a vast superior place on a marvelously raised high seat, which was also spread out for non-Buddhist practitioners.

source_sentence: 諸國外道皆集其會，及室羅筏城百千萬億一切人民亦集其處。
translation: All the roads of various countries and hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of people in Śrāvastī also assembled there.

source_sentence: 其中或為看論議者，其中亦有善根成熟，俱來集會。
translation: Some of them might want to see the discussion, and some of them also have good roots that are ripened, so they all come to the assembly.

source_sentence: 爾時具壽舍利弗，與給孤長者及諸眷屬，前後圍繞而來赴會，遍觀大眾誰堪調伏。
translation: It was then that Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra, the elder Anāthapiṇḍika and his retinues came to the assembly, surrounded by them in front and behind him, observing who among the masses could subdue them.

source_sentence: 即便微笑整肅威儀，尋昇論座，一切大眾一心合掌瞻仰舍利弗。
translation: He then smiled and, with proper manner and deportment, ascended to his seat to discuss the matter. All the members of the assembly joined their palms in unison to venerate Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗即告諸外道：『為我立宗汝破？
translation: Śāriputra then addressed the non-Buddhists, 'Did you establish a doctrine for me and refute it?'

source_sentence: 為汝立宗我破？』
translation: Is I establish a doctrine for you and refute it for you?'

source_sentence: 外道答曰：『我先立宗。』
translation: The non-Buddhist replied, 'First, I established the doctrine.'

source_sentence: 舍利弗作如是念：『若我先立宗，人亦不能難破，除佛世尊，況赤眼外道！』
translation: Śāriputra thought, 'If I had established the doctrine first, it wouldn't be difficult for people to refute it, except for the Bhagavān, so why wouldn't a non-Buddhist with red eyes?'

source_sentence: 便作是念報外道曰：『任汝立宗，我當隨破。』
translation: He then had this thought to repay the non-Buddhist, saying, 'Let me establish a doctrine for you, and I will follow it and break it down.'

source_sentence: 彼赤眼善解方術，即便化作大菴沒羅樹，開花結實。
translation: That red-eyed man well understands the directional technique, and he transforms himself into a large sandalwood tree that blooms with flowers and fruit.

source_sentence: 具壽舍利弗，為大風雨摧樹拔根，須臾散滅，時解術者而不能見。
translation: Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra destroyed the tree with a great wind and rain, uprooted its roots, and dispersed them in an instant. But those who understood the technique could not see him.

source_sentence: 外道又化作一蓮花大池；
translation: The heretic also magically created a large lotus-flower pond.

source_sentence: 具壽舍利弗化為象子踐池折花，尋復平地。
translation: Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra transformed himself into the elephant-child, trampled the pond and broke down the flowers, and returned to the level ground.

source_sentence: 外道化為七頭龍王；
translation: A heretic is said to be a seven-headed dragon king.

source_sentence: 舍利弗化為大金翅鳥，從空飛下食龍而去。
translation: Śāriputra transformed himself into a great garuḍa and flew down from the sky to feed on the dragon and departed.

source_sentence: 外道化為起屍鬼，令前害舍利弗；
translation: A heretic was transformed into a corpse-producing spirit and caused Śāriputra to be harmed before him.

source_sentence: 舍利弗以呪呪之，令鬼却迴損害外道。
translation: Śāriputra cursed them with a spell that caused the ghosts to turn away and harmed the non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 外道怖急下座，五體投地禮舍利弗，作如是言：『願救我命！
translation: Fearful, the non-Buddhist descended from his seat and bowed to Śāriputra with five bodies, saying, 'Please save my life!'

source_sentence: 願救我命！』
translation: May you save my life!'

source_sentence: 時舍利弗攝呪力已，其鬼即滅，為赤眼外道說法，便發信心，從座而起頂禮雙足白言：『願聽我善法律中出家，受具足戒成苾芻性，求為弟子而修梵行。』
translation: After he had gathered the power of the spell, Śāriputra ceased that ghost and taught the Dharma to the non-Buddhist red-eyed monks, then aroused faith, rose from his seat, bowed his head at their feet, and said, 'May you hear me leave home in good law, receive the full set of precepts to become a bhikṣu, and cultivate the religious practice

source_sentence: 作是語已，時舍利弗，即令剃髮受具足戒，精勤修習不久之間，證無學果，三明六通具八解脫，得如實智：我生已盡、梵行已立、所作已辦、不受後有，心無障礙如手揮空，刀割香塗愛憎不起，觀金與土等無有異，於諸名利無不棄捨，釋梵諸天悉皆供養。
translation: Having said these words, Śāriputra then caused the hair to shave and receive the full set of precepts, diligently cultivated them for a short time, realized the fruit of post-learners, possessed the three insights, six supernormal powers, and eight liberations, attained knowledge as it really is: that my birth has ended, the religious practice has been established, what I will do has been done, I won

source_sentence: 是時大眾見此驚怪，各各嗟仰，於舍利子處皆發信心，作如是語：『聖者舍利子！
translation: Seeing this wonder, the masses of people were all amazed and admired each other, and at Śāriputra's place they all aroused faith and said, 'Noble one, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 破大論議師調伏外道。』
translation: He refutes the teacher of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā and subdues non-Buddhists.'

source_sentence: 大眾一心合掌瞻仰舍利子。
translation: The whole group of people with one mind joined their palms and looked up to Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 是時具壽舍利子，知彼大眾意樂煩惱，六界自性了知說法，此是證四諦。
translation: At the time, Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra knew the mental afflictions of those masses and the self-nature of the six realms to know and teach the Dharma, which are the four truths of realization.

source_sentence: 彼大眾聞已，無量百千有情得大殊勝，有發聲聞心、有發辟支佛心、有發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心、有發三歸心受五戒、有證須陀洹果、有得斯陀含、有證阿那含、有得出家斷一切煩惱得阿羅漢果。
translation: After hearing this, measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings attained great superiority, some who aroused the mind of śrāvakas, some who aroused the mind of pratyekabuddha, some who aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, some who aroused the mind of three refuges to receive the five precepts, some who realized the fruit of stream

source_sentence: 是時大眾，於佛法僧所深生敬心。
translation: The masses then had deep respect for the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha.

source_sentence: 時舍利子說是法已却歸本處，給孤長者及諸眷屬，一切人民皆大歡喜，作禮而去。
translation: After he taught this teaching, Śāriputra returned to his original place and paid homage to the orphaned elder and his retinues, and all the people were greatly delighted, bowed, and departed.

source_sentence: 「時諸外道心生惱恨，各相謂曰：『我等不能破得舍利子，我等須作方便殺彼舍利子，先須入此寺中傭力，作諸伺候得便之處，即須斷命。』
translation: The non-Buddhists then became angry and said to each other, 'We can't break through Śāriputra; we must kill him with skillful means. First, we must enter this monastery as a hired servant or waiter in order to get an advantage over him, and then we must cut off his life.'

source_sentence: 時諸外道詣給孤長者曰：『汝今奪我諸勝利養，我先久住不忍捨離此國，唯願慈悲，於寺中許我傭力。』
translation: The non-Buddhist monks then went to the orphaned elder and said, 'Now, you've taken away my benefits and supports, for which I've lived here for a long time and can't bear to part with this country; please have mercy and pity and allow me to work as a servant in the monastery.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『待我白舍利弗。』
translation: The elder replied, 'Wait until I tell Śāriputra.'

source_sentence: 便即詣具壽舍利弗所，到已而白尊者言：『聖者！
translation: He then went to Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra, arrived, and said to the venerable, 'Noble one!

source_sentence: 今諸外道作如是言：「汝斷我諸利養，唯願垂慈，許我寺中有所傭力。
translation: Now, the non-Buddhists say, You cut off my benefits and offerings, but please have mercy on me and allow me to have a servant in my monastery.

source_sentence: 由我等久住於此，不能捨離其國。」』
translation: Because we've been here for a long time, we can't abandon our country.'

source_sentence: 舍利子聞斯語已，便即觀察：彼外道等有善根不？
translation: Having heard these words, Śāriputra immediately observed:

source_sentence: 既觀察已知有善根。
translation: Having observed it, he knows that there are good roots.

source_sentence: 復觀察彼等誰能調伏？
translation: Again, observe who can subdue them?

source_sentence: 觀知我能調伏，告長者曰：『可然！
translation: Knowing that I can subdue them, he told the elder, 'Yes!

source_sentence: 終不相違。』
translation: They're never at odds with each other.'

source_sentence: 彼外道等，即於寺內起首傭力。
translation: Those non-Buddhists and others then gave rise to the power of the chief hired servants inside the temple.

source_sentence: 時舍利子化作二執杖當諸作人，其性甚暴驅逐彼人。
translation: Śāriputra then transformed himself into two men holding sticks and gave them to the doers, who were very violent by nature and expelled them.

source_sentence: 舍利子知彼等調伏時至，相去不遠，於樹林下而以經行。
translation: Knowing that the time for their submission was approaching, Śāriputra not far from each other, he took a walk under a tree in a forest.

source_sentence: 彼外道見經行已，便作是念：『比來伺候今正便宜。』
translation: Seeing the sūtras and practices, those non-Buddhists then thought, 'The Bhagavān, who's waiting for them, is exactly what's cheaper now.'

source_sentence: 諸人一時而來圍遶。
translation: All the people came and surrounded him at once.

source_sentence: 舍利子見已，起觀察心：彼外道等擬作何意而來我所？
translation: Seeing this, Śāriputra arose and observed: What did those heretics intend to do in order to come to me?

source_sentence: 乃見彼等為害我故一時來。
translation: They then saw that they had come at once for the sake of harming me.

source_sentence: 此時化執杖人，即來驅迫以杖鞭撻，便即告曰：『汝等應往造作。』
translation: At that point, the person holding the staff of the teaching came and expelled him with a stick and whipped him, and then he told them, 'You should go and make it.'

source_sentence: 彼即同聲告曰：『舍利子！
translation: They then said in unison, 'Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 願救我等。』
translation: May you save us.'

source_sentence: 舍利弗語執杖人：『汝且去，任彼止息。』
translation: Śāriputra said to the person holding the staff, 'Go away, and let him stop.'

source_sentence: 彼外道便作斯念，共相謂曰：『此舍利子有大威德，我等皆發害心，此於我所而起慈心。』
translation: The non-Buddhists then had this thought, saying to each other, 'This Śāriputra has great authority and virtue, and we all aroused the intention to harm him, which is to give rise to compassion for me.'

source_sentence: 作是言已便生信心。
translation: After saying this, he then gave rise to faith.

source_sentence: 舍利子觀見彼等意樂隨眠界行自性，知已，隨其根器說四聖諦法。
translation: Śāriputra observed the self-nature of those mental states as latent tendencies, and knowing it, he explained the teachings of the four noble truths according to their faculties and abilities.

source_sentence: 由聞法故，彼等皆以金剛智杵摧破二十種薩迦耶見山已，現證預流果。
translation: Because of hearing the teaching, they all used the vajra wisdom pounder to destroy the twenty kinds of sarvajñaskandha mountains and now realize the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 彼等見實諦已，皆白舍利子言：『大德！
translation: Having seen the true truth, they all said to Śāriputra, 'O great virtuous one!

source_sentence: 唯願聽我等於善教法中調伏出家，受具足戒得苾芻性，我等於舍利子所可修梵行。』
translation: May you hear that we will be disciplined and renounce the householder's life in the well-taught teaching, receive the full set of precepts, and attain the status of monk, so that we can cultivate the religious practice in what Śāriputra teaches.'

source_sentence: 時舍利子度彼外道授具足戒，教應作事，彼等漸次精勤修習，見此五種生死輪轉動搖，一切行趣摧滅，破壞離散之性。
translation: Śāriputra then liberated those non-Buddhists and gave them the full set of precepts, teaching them what should be done, and they gradually diligently cultivate it in order to see these five kinds of birth-and-death cyclic waves that destroy all conditioned destinies and destroy the nature of disintegration.

source_sentence: 既了知已，斷諸煩惱證阿羅漢，三明六通具八解脫，得如實智：我生已盡、梵行已立、所作已辦、不受後有，心無障礙如手揮空，刀割香塗愛憎不起，觀金與土等無有異，於諸名利無不棄捨，釋梵諸天悉皆供養。
translation: Having realized it, they cut off all afflictions and realize arhatship, the three insights, the six supernormal powers, and the eight liberations, attain true knowledge that self-existence has ended, the religious practice has been established, what's to be done has been done, isn't subject to future existence, their mind is unobstructed like holding an empty hand in space, a sword cuts fragrance

source_sentence: 「爾時舍利弗與給孤獨長者，以手執繩量地置寺。
translation: At the time, Śāriputra and the elder Anāthapiṇḍika were carrying a rope in their hands and placing it on a ground the size of a monastery.

source_sentence: 具壽舍利子即便微笑，給孤獨長者既見笑已，尋即白言：『聖者舍利子！
translation: Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra then smiled, and when he saw the orphaned elderly man with a smile, he looked around and said, 'Noble one, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 世尊及諸弟子，無因不笑。
translation: The Bhagavān and his disciples didn't laugh for no reason.

source_sentence: 今者微笑，有何因緣？』
translation: Now, what's the reason for this smile?'

source_sentence: 舍利子答曰：『如是，如是！
translation: Śāriputra replied, 'So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 長者！
translation: Elder!

source_sentence: 世尊及諸弟子無因不笑。
translation: The Bhagavān and his disciples didn't laugh for no reason.

source_sentence: 今所笑者，當爾長者執繩量地之時，彼淨居天純金宮殿早已成就，以是因緣我今微笑。』
translation: The reason I'm smiling now is that when you were holding a rope to measure the ground, that pure gold palace of the Pure Land of the Pure Land of the Pure Land of the Pure Land of the Pure Land of the Pure Land of the Pure Land of the Pure Land had already been completed, and for this reason I'm smiling now.'

source_sentence: 長者聞已即大歡喜告舍利弗：『實若如是，更廣其繩大造立寺。』
translation: After hearing this, the elder rejoiced greatly and told Śāriputra, 'If that's true, then he'll expand his rope and build a large temple.'

source_sentence: 便發弘願。
translation: He then gave rise to the great vow.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗隨長者意闊引其繩，是時長者更廣發願大造其寺，時淨居天四寶宮殿還已成就。
translation: Śāriputra then led the rope widely according to the elder's wishes, and the elder then made an even more extensive vow to build a large temple, which was then completed in the four-jeweled palace of the Pure Land Heaven.

source_sentence: 舍利弗見已歡喜復告長者：『彼淨居天由汝願廣，過前宮殿，四寶所成。』
translation: After seeing this, Śāriputra rejoiced and again told the elder, 'That purely abiding goddes because of your vow to have it expand beyond the previous palace, which was made of the four treasures.'

source_sentence: 聞此語已倍加嚴飾，更多造寺滿十六所，其置寺外，別造六十四院，悉皆重閣。
translation: Having heard these words, the Master doubled his adornments and built sixteen more monasteries, all of which were located outside the monastery. There were sixty-four courts separately arranged in sixty-four sections, all multistoried pavilions.

source_sentence: 既造了已，供寺所須家具悉足。
translation: After it had been built, all the necessary furnishings for the temple were provided.

source_sentence: 爾時給孤獨長者往具壽舍利子所，到已禮訖在一面立問言：『聖者！
translation: It was then that the orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika went to Kauśāriputra, paid his respects, stood to one side, and asked, 'Noble one!

source_sentence: 世尊出遊日行幾許？』
translation: Bhagavān, how long does the Bhagavān travel each day?'

source_sentence: 舍利子曰：『如轉輪王所行之法。』
translation: Śāriputra said, 'It's like the teaching practiced by a wheel-turning king.'

source_sentence: 又問曰：『輪王日行幾何？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'How long does the wheel-turning king walk each day?'

source_sentence: 報曰：『輪王日行兩踰繕那半。』
translation: He replied, 'The wheel-turning king travels two yojanas and a half a day.'

source_sentence: 時給孤長者，從室羅筏城於其中間，計兩驛半置四事供養，時、非時食悉皆充足。
translation: From the city of Śrāvastī, the orphaned elder was given two and a half shillings to offer four kinds of offerings, which were all plentiful at the time and non-times.

source_sentence: 建吉祥門立一首領，總知事務，嚴飾幡蓋及以寶幢，栴檀香水灑散其地，布眾名花，雜寶香爐置於衢路，作是事已告使者曰：『汝今可往詣世尊所頂禮雙足，當陳我言奉問世尊：「起居輕利、小病少惱、安樂行不？
translation: He set up the monastery gates of auspicious signs and established a music hall. Knowing all the affairs, he adorned himself with pennants, canopies, jeweled banners, sandalwood fragrance sprinkled over the ground, spread various kinds of famous flowers, placed incense burners made of mixed jewels on the street corners, and after doing so, told his messengers, “

source_sentence: 唯願世尊及苾芻眾，向室羅筏城，我以盡形四事供養，冀無闕乏。」』
translation: May the Bhagavān and the monks go to the city of Śrāvastī, and I'll make offerings in all four ways so that there won't be any lack.'

source_sentence: 使受教已即往王舍城，詣世尊所頂禮雙足，即住一面白世尊曰：『彼給孤長者，頂禮世尊雙足而白世尊：「起居輕利、少病少惱、安樂行不？
translation: Having received the instruction, the envoy went to Rājagaha and came to the place where the World-honored One was staying. After bowing his forehead at [the Buddha’s] feet, he stood to one side and said to the World-honored One:

source_sentence: 唯願世尊及苾芻眾，向室羅筏城，盡我一生四事供養，冀無闕乏。」』
translation: May the Bhagavān and the monks go to the city of Śrāvastī and make offerings of four things in my lifetime, so that they won't lack them.'

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：『給孤長者及汝己身，願常安樂。』
translation: The Bhagavān told him, 'Give it to the orphaned elder and your own body, wishing for constant well-being.'

source_sentence: 使者白世尊已，復白世尊曰：『給孤長者作如是語：「唯願世尊及苾芻眾，向室羅筏城來，盡我一生四事供養。」』
translation: After the messenger had said this to the Bhagavān, he also said to the Bhagavān, 'The orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika made these words, May the Bhagavān and the monks come to the city of Śrāvastī to make four offerings for the rest of my life.'

source_sentence: 世尊爾時默然而受。
translation: The Bhagavān then remained silent and accepted it.

source_sentence: 使者見世尊默然受已，作禮而去。
translation: Seeing the Bhagavān, the messenger accepted it in silence, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊由自調伏故，調伏圍遶；
translation: “At that time the World-honored One disciplined himself and surrounded [by his disciples].

source_sentence: 自寂靜故，寂靜圍遶；
translation: Because they themselves are quiescent, they are surrounded by quiescence.

source_sentence: 自解脫故，解脫圍遶；
translation: Because of self-liberation, they are surrounded by liberation.

source_sentence: 自安隱故，安隱圍遶；
translation: Because of their own peace, they are surrounded by peace.

source_sentence: 自善順故，善順圍遶；
translation: Because they themselves are well disposed, they are well surrounded by them.

source_sentence: 自應供故，應供圍遶；
translation: Because they themselves should make offerings, they should be surrounded by those who should make offerings.

source_sentence: 自離欲故，離欲圍遶；
translation: Because they themselves are free from desire, they are free from being surrounded by desire.

source_sentence: 自端嚴故，端嚴圍遶；
translation: Because of their self-adornment, they are surrounded by adornment.

source_sentence: 猶如牛王，牛眾圍遶；
translation: It is like a king of bulls, surrounded by the herd of cows.

source_sentence: 猶如象王，小象圍遶；
translation: It is like an elephant king, surrounded by small elephants.

source_sentence: 如師子王，師子圍遶；
translation: They are like the king of lions, surrounded by lions.

source_sentence: 猶如鵝王，諸鵝圍遶；
translation: They’re like a king of geese, surrounded by other geese.

source_sentence: 猶如妙翅鳥王，諸鳥圍遶；
translation: It is like a king of garuḍas with beautiful wings, surrounded by birds.

source_sentence: 如婆羅門學士，學徒圍遶；
translation: It is like the case of a brāhmaṇa’s apprentice, who is surrounded by his students.

source_sentence: 猶如大醫，病者圍遶；
translation: It is as if a great physician were to surround the sick man.

source_sentence: 猶如大將，眾勇圍遶；
translation: It is like a general, surrounded by his men of great strength.

source_sentence: 如大導師，行旅圍遶；
translation: It is as if the great Guide had traveled all around him.

source_sentence: 猶如商主，眾商圍遶；
translation: It is just like a caravan leader, surrounded by many merchants.

source_sentence: 如大長者，諸長者圍遶；
translation: It is like a great wealthy man, surrounded by wealthy people.

source_sentence: 猶如國王，諸臣圍遶；
translation: He was like a king surrounded by his ministers.

source_sentence: 如轉輪王，千子圍遶；
translation: He was like a universal ruler, surrounded by a thousand sons.

source_sentence: 猶如明月，眾星圍遶；
translation: It is like the bright moon, surrounded by many stars.

source_sentence: 猶如日輪，千光圍遶；
translation: It is like the sun, surrounded by a thousand rays of light.

source_sentence: 猶如持國天王，乾闥婆圍遶；
translation: It is as if a heavenly ruler were to rule over the whole empire, surrounded by gandharvas.

source_sentence: 猶如增長天王，鳩槃茶圍遶；
translation: It is as if he were the king of the growing heavens, surrounded by kumbhāṇḍa.

source_sentence: 猶如醜目天王，龍眾圍遶；
translation: They are like the ugly-eyed celestial kings, surrounded by a host of dragons.

source_sentence: 猶如多聞天王，藥叉眾圍遶；
translation: He was like the well-versed celestial king, surrounded by a host of yakṣas.

source_sentence: 如淨妙王，阿蘇羅圍遶；
translation: He was like the king Pure and Wonderful, surrounded by asuras.

source_sentence: 如天帝釋，三十三天圍遶；
translation: They are like Indra the ruler of gods, surrounded by the thirty-three celestial kings.

source_sentence: 如梵天王，梵天圍遶；
translation: They are like the Brahma heavenly kings, surrounded by Brahma gods.

source_sentence: 猶如大海，湛然安靜；
translation: It is as calm and peaceful as the great ocean.

source_sentence: 猶如大雲，靉靆垂布；
translation: It is like a great cloud draped with silk.

translation: The elephants, horses, and other animals in the city all raised their voices.

source_sentence: 所有家具資身之物，一時自鳴。
translation: All the pieces of household goods and personal belongings he possessed all sounded simultaneously in his voice.

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊及諸大眾，既入城內，見是希奇種種異事。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān and the assembled crowd had entered the city and saw these rare and various strange things.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊從室羅筏城中，與苾芻眾同至寺所，敷座而坐。
translation: The Bhagavān then left the city of Śrāvastī and went with the monks to the monastery, spread out his seat, and sat down.

source_sentence: 時給孤獨長者，并諸眷屬前後圍遶，俱詣佛所，金瓶盛水盥世尊手，其水不出。
translation: The orphaned elder Anāthapiṇḍika and his retinues then went to the Buddha, surrounded by them in front and behind him. A golden pot filled with water poured water over the World-honored One’s hands but the water didn’t come out.

source_sentence: 長者憂惱便作是念：『我今應有宿世罪障，令水不出。』
translation: The elder was distressed and thought, 'Now, I should have the sins of past lives that will prevent water from coming out.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼長者心之所念，便即告言：『汝無罪障，此之寺地，汝曾往昔已造毘訶羅，施佛及僧伽。
translation: Knowing what the wealthy man thought, the World-honored One said to him: You are not guilty of any offense. In the past you built a monastery at this place and offered it to the Buddha and the sangha in order to make offerings to the holy ones.

source_sentence: 汝今注水，非是昔日舊立施處，所以瓶水不為汝出，汝可移立舊施寺處。』
translation: You're pouring water now, not the place where you used to stand as a donor in the past; therefore, the water from the pot won't come out for you; you can move it to the place where you stood as an old donor.'

source_sentence: 長者受教便立舊處，其水即出。
translation: As instructed, the elder stood up in his old place and water immediately flowed out.

source_sentence: 世尊便出五種妙音廣為讚歎，欲呪願時，誓多太子心作是念：『唯願世尊先說我名。』
translation: The Bhagavān then produced five kinds of wonderful sounds that were extensively praised by the Bhagavān, and when he wanted to make a spell or vow, Prince Jīvaka had this thought in his mind, 'May the Bhagavān first explain my name.'

source_sentence: 世尊知已，隨誓多心告諸苾芻：『此誓多林給孤獨園，施佛及四方苾芻僧伽。』
translation: Knowing this, the Bhagavān followed his vow and addressed the monks with many hearts, saying, 'This is a vow to give an orphaned park to the Buddha and the four directional monks and nuns of the saṃgha in the forest.'

source_sentence: 是時誓多太子聞世尊先稱己名，即大歡喜起大信心，為佛造立寺門四寶所成。
translation: Upon hearing the Bhagavān's name first proclaimed, Prince Jīvaka rejoiced greatly and had great faith, built a temple gate for the Buddha and made it out of four treasures.

source_sentence: 為此因緣結集聖者蘇呾羅中說云：『佛在室羅筏城逝多林給孤獨園。』
translation: For this reason, it's said in the Sutra of the Collection of Sages that the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta's Grove in Śrāvastī.
